def_en: A freak event or action is one that is a very unusual or extreme example of its type.

def_cn: (对某事物或活动痴迷的)…狂
def_en: See also:control freak; If you describe someone as a particular kind of freak, you are emphasizing that they are very enthusiastic about a thing or activity, and often seem to think about nothing else.
People are sometimes referred to as freaks when their behaviour or attitude is very different from that of the majority of people.

def_cn: 畸形(人)(可能具冒犯意味)
def_en: If you refer to someone as a freak, you mean that they are physically abnormal in some way. This use could cause offence.

def_cn: (使)吃惊;(使)不安;(使)恼怒;(使)困惑
def_en: If someone freaks, or if something freaks them, they suddenly feel extremely surprised, upset, angry, or confused.

def_cn: (使)吃惊;(使)不安;(使)恼怒;(使)困惑
def_en: If someone freaks out, or if something freaks them out, they suddenly feel extremely surprised, upset, angry, or confused.
